text: Hello
Hi! How are you?
Doing well thank you.  And yourself?
I'm doing okay.
Good.  I promise I'm not a bot, lol.  Watching the UCF-UConn game and doing some Turks.
Who are you cheering for?
UCF.  Last year\'s "National Champions"
I went to UCF for a semester. Love the campus! Not really a sport's person myself though.
Wow!  Small world!
It is! Are you from Florida?
I am.  Orlando...well, DeBary, right down the road.  I work downtown for The Dr. Phillips Center, a non profit performing arts center.
I'm originally from Tampa. Moved to Texas about 2 years ago.
Cool.  Don't mess with Texas, right?  So speaking of non-profits, would you be interested in donating some of your bonus from this HIT to Save the Children?
Can you tell me about it?

Sure.  Save the Children gives children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. When crisis strikes, they are always among the first to respond and the last to leave. They do whatever it takes to save children, transforming their lives and the future we all share.  They are a worldwide organization and I believe even assisted with the response to Hurricane Harvey in Houston last year.
So they are a crisis response organization?
Yup.  They are helping out with the Syrian refugee crisis, Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria, the earthquakes in Japan, the earthquake in Haiti a few years ago... even as far back as Katrina.
How much of the donation goes directly to the children?

100% of your donation goes to it according to the creators of this Turk.  You can donate any amount of your bonus and the rest of the bonus is yours to keep.  I even use a Chome extension call Tabs for a Cause and donate to them through that extension all the time
No non profit can give 100% of the donation to the intended recipient. There are costs to take care of first.

Yeah, that\'s true.  The only information I have to work with in regards to how much of this particular donation that goes to the children is what the research organizers say: "The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children."  However, according to Charity Navigator, 88.3% of their donations go to their mission (the children).
Without time to do more research, I don't think I'll donate.

Not even 50 cents?  44 of which will go to those kids?  Don't make me start playing the Sarah McLachlan music with the children in the background because the researchers gave me the ability to do that...
No, I like to completely research any causes I donate to.
"I will remember youuuuuuuuuu... *sad child from Hurricane Harvey"  "Will you remember meeeee?" *sad child from earthquake*
